result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mercedes Deanna Pennington

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Atty Lockery states that a global agreement had been reached with the State.
Plea/Sentencing date to be set.
Atty Lockery to go to the Branch 3 JA and get a date for the plea/sentencing hearing.
ADA Pfeil does not need to address bond at this time.

3:05 PM Defendant Mercedes Deanna Pennington appeared by video, in custody from Taycheedah Corretional.  Attorney Jason Matthew Lockery in court for Mercedes Deanna Pennington.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
Atty Lockery did file a waiver of preliminary hearing.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver filed by Atty Jason Lockery
filed by Atty Jason Matthew Lockery
